side_effects.name: Unspecified disorder of autonomic nervous system

contraindications.reason: Beta-agonist increases heart rate and arrhythmia risk
Risk of myocardial ischemia with high doses
High doses may lower seizure threshold
Use only if benefits outweigh risks

demographic_risks.recommendations: Start with lower doses. Monitor heart rate and potassium.
Use with caution. Monitor cardiovascular status closely.
Weight-based dosing. Watch for paradoxical reactions.
Use if clearly needed for asthma control.
Use lowest effective dose. Monitor heart rate.
Avoid if possible or use with extreme caution.
May need higher doses. Cardioselective beta-blockers preferred.

drug_interactions.recommendation: Avoid non-selective beta-blockers in asthma. Use cardioselective if needed.
Avoid timolol eye drops in asthma patients.
Monitor heart rate and potassium. Effective combination for severe asthma.

drug_interactions.clinical_effect: Increased risk of torsades de pointes

drug_interactions.recommendation: Monitor heart rate and blood pressure.

drug_interactions.clinical_effect: Slightly reduced bronchodilation at high doses
Slightly reduced bronchodilation at high doses

drug_interactions.recommendation: Reduce caffeine intake if side effects occur.
Monitor glucose. Usually not clinically significant.
